title: Discrimination in Employment
scenario: A qualified woman is denied a job because of her gender. Analyze whether this violates any constitutional rights.
clues: Article 16: Equality of Opportunity in Public Employment
solution: The denial of employment based on gender violates Article 15, which prohibits discrimination on the grounds of religion, race, caste, sex, or place of birth.

title: Caste-Based Discrimination
scenario: A person from a lower caste is refused entry to a public park. Analyze whether this violates any constitutional rights.
solution: Refusing entry to a public park based on caste violates Article 17, which abolishes untouchability and forbids such discrimination.

title: Reservation in Educational Institutions
scenario: A student from a reserved category is given admission preference in a government-run educational institution. Analyze whether this violates any constitutional rights.
clues: Article 16: Equality of Opportunity in Public Employment
Article 46: Promotion of Educational and Economic Interests of Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and other Weaker Sections
correctAnswer: Article 46: Promotion of Educational and Economic Interests
solution: The reservation policy does not violate Article 14, as Article 46 encourages the state to promote the educational and economic interests of weaker sections, including SC/ST categories.

title: Denial of Voting Rights
scenario: A person from a specific minority group is denied the right to vote. Analyze whether this violates any constitutional rights.
clues: Article 326: Elections to the House of the People and to the Legislative Assemblies of States
correctAnswer: Article 326: Elections to the House of the People and to the Legislative Assemblies of States
solution: Denying voting rights based on group identity violates Article 326, which ensures that elections are conducted based on universal adult suffrage, irrespective of religion, race, caste, or sex.

title: Abolition of Titles
scenario: A wealthy businessman is given the honorary title of ‘Sir’ by a foreign government and uses it in India. Analyze whether this violates any constitutional rights.
clues: Article 16: Equality of Opportunity in Public Employment
Article 19: Freedom of Speech and Expression
solution: Using titles like ‘Sir’ awarded by a foreign government violates Article 18, which prohibits Indian citizens from accepting titles from foreign states.
